description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a386j","text":"This protocol describes the visualisation of dendritic spines of human neurons cultured on coverslips in vitro and subsequent quantification using the software Imaris.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":102,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"16dd6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"8qt5h","text":"Reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2mbr5","text":"SlowFade™ Diamond Antifade Mountant (ThermoFisher Scientific, CAT# S36967)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":35}],"data":[]},{"key":"d8ks1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ddk3s","text":"Equipment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ekjn5","text":"Olympus FluoViewTM FV1000 Confocal Microscope","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":16,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"455eu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1hrvm","text":"Software:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5gulg","text":"Imaris v9.6.0 (Bitplane, South Windsor, CT, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C82DB550AD4911ED836D23E610D62C76","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/S36967"}}}}

parent_collections.title: Do, Q. B. et al. (2023) Early striatal hyperexcitability in an in vitro human striatal microcircuit model carrying the Parkinson’s GBA-N370S mutation

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Visualisation of fluorescent dendritic spines in MSNs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2muk6","text":"Mount a coverslip of Medium Spiny Neurons (MSNs) immunolabelled for DARP32 and neurobiotin onto SlowFade™ Diamond Antifade mountant (follow Protocol: Immunocytochemistry of cultured human Medium Spiny Neurons (MSNs)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":140,"length":75}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":140,"length":75}],"data":{}},{"key":"dqig8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A575F240D94311EDA2A0CFB02D80411D","url":"https://www.protocols.io/private/AC01BFAE0F9A5D046F15611276916014"}}}}

steps.section: Visualisation of fluorescent dendritic spines in MSNs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"crosv","text":"Place slide under under Olympus FluoView FV1000 confocal microscope with argon and solid-state laser with 488 nm and 559 nm excitation, respectively. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Visualisation of fluorescent dendritic spines in MSNs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1hent","text":"Use the 60x oil-immersion objective (NA = 1.40) to image and capture MSNs coexpressing Darpp32 and Neurobiotin as Z-stacks, sampling sequentially at resolution of 1024 * 1024 pixels and at 1.05 µm steps, as optimised by Nyquist sampling theorem.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Visualisation of fluorescent dendritic spines in MSNs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"88ngj","text":"Use the zoom function (3x) in the Olympus Dendritic FluoView FV1000 software to capture dendritic branches of biotinylated neurons.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8imor","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3cd49","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f4nma","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9s4dk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3537h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c0iep","text":"Approximately 2-4 images are captured per neurons, depending on image quality. ","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61gl1","text":"Use the 'Surface' module to threshold and segment the confocal images.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ekfk5","text":"Use the 'Filament' module to automatically render the dendrites from images obtained after step 5.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cdre","text":"Choose the spine detection function in the 'Filament' module to detect spines as protrusions from the previously-identified dendritic filament. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"96s87","text":"Manually exclude putative spines at branch points or disconnected dots.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Visualisation and quantification of dendritic spines in cultured human Medium Spiny Neurons (MSNs)
